title: Amerigroup?
content:
Looking to find the name of the “Amerigroup” font.  
I know the red lettering is Mistral [lol] but  
if anyone has an idea about the blue, I’d love to hear it.

Thanks a bunch in advance!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Amerigroup\_2Color.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706084326/http:/typophile.com/files/Amerigroup_2Color.jpg) | 280.49 KB |

 [‹ Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706084326/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43002 "Go to previous forum topic") [help with this logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706084326/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43004 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Plan B

comments.content:
Amerigroup looks quite similar to a font called [’LHF Charlotte’](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706084326/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/SerifGuide/serifsamples/serif_c/charlotte_lhf_full.gif) by Denise Bayers. The serifs are quite small and don’t show up well in this image from my [Serif Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706084326/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/SerifGuide/intro.php). I cannot find this font at Letterhead Fonts anymore, but I had the design date for this as 2002. One of Bayers’ fonts is still sold there and she may know more about this font. It’s possible the Amerigroup lettering was a custom version of the same lettering, because the U appears narrower in the logo, and it’s possible the serifs were also modified for the logo. The letter shapes still seem quite similar, including the open P.

- Mike Yanega
